page.title: 03KNIGHTS TEMPLAR AND WITHAM.
page.content: The first village was at{Chipping {(Cheping)}Hill.Cheping means market. It was on the green by the church.There is a young oak tree on the green.There was one long ago.{King {Stephen}gave the manor of Witham to the{Knights Templar.}They were brave, strong and tough men who fought in the Crusades.Their headquarters was in Solomon's Temple in Jerusalem. They protected pilgrims on the rough and stoney road to Jerusalem. Money made from selling the corn grown in Witham paid for this. There are huge barns at Cressing that they built to store corn. One of the schools is called Templars, their badge has a knight and a Templars cross on it. Templars were given land in{Newland {Street}on their discharge from the Service.
